content.question: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 2 times the tangent of, open parenthesis, x over 5, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the line <math alttext="y equals, 5 minus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. What is the volume of the solid generated when <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the line <math alttext="y equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
